com.agenarisk.api.model

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.agenarisk.api.model.Node
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Identifiable<NodeException>, Networked<Node>, Storable, java.lang.Comparable<Node>

    public class Node
extends java.lang.Object
implements Networked<Node>, java.lang.Comparable<Node>, Identifiable<NodeException>, Storable
    Node class represents an equivalent to a Node in AgenaRisk Desktop or ExtendedBN in AgenaRisk Java API v1.

      • linkTo

        public Link linkTo(Node child)
            throws LinkException
        Creates a simple Link from this Node to given Node in the same Network.
        If child table is in Manual mode, this action will reset it to a uniform table.
        Parameters:
        child - the child Node
        Returns:
        created Link
        Throws:
        LinkException - if Link already exists, or a cross network link is being created (use Node.linkNodes() for that instead)

      • linkFrom

        public Link linkFrom(Node parent)
              throws LinkException
        Creates a simple Link from the given Node to this Node in the same Network.
        If this Node's table is in Manual mode, this action will reset it to a uniform table.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent Node
        Returns:
        created Link
        Throws:
        LinkException - if Link already exists, or a cross network link is being created (use Node.linkNodes() for that instead)

      • unlinkNodes

        public static boolean unlinkNodes(Node node1,
                                  Node node2)
        Checks that there is a Link between two nodes and destroys it. No effect if there is no link between these two nodes.
        Parameters:
        node1 - Node 1
        node2 - Node 2
        Returns:
        true if the link was destroyed, false if there was no link

      • linkNodes

        public static Link linkNodes(Node fromNode,
                             Node toNode)
                      throws LinkException
        Creates a simple Link between two nodes in the same Network.
        Parameters:
        fromNode - Node to link from
        toNode - Node to link to
        Returns:
        created Link
        Throws:
        LinkException - if Link already exists, or a cross network link is being created

      • linkNodes

        public static Link linkNodes(Node fromNode,
                             Node toNode,
                             Ref.LINK_TYPE type)
                      throws LinkException
        Creates a Link between two nodes in same or different Networks.
        Parameters:
        fromNode - Node to link from
        toNode - Node to link to
        type - type of CrossNetworkLink if applicable
        Returns:
        created Link
        Throws:
        LinkException - if Link already exists, or a cross network link is being created with invalid arguments

      • linkNodes

        public static Link linkNodes(Node fromNode,
                             Node toNode,
                             Ref.LINK_TYPE type,
                             java.lang.String stateToPass)
                      throws LinkException
        Creates a Link between two nodes in same or different Networks.
        The underlying NPT of the child node will be reset to some default value.
        Parameters:
        fromNode - Node to link from
        toNode - Node to link to
        type - type of CrossNetworkLink if applicable
        stateToPass - if type is State, this specifies the state to pass
        Returns:
        created Link
        Throws:
        LinkException - if Link already exists, or a cross network link is being created with invalid arguments

      • setTableColumns

        public void setTableColumns(double[][] columns)
                     throws NodeException
        Sets the manual NPT according to columns provided.
        Parameters:
        columns - 2D array where first dimension are the columns and second dimension are the cells
        Throws:
        NodeException - if provided table size is wrong or Node does not allow manual NPT

      • setTableRows

        public void setTableRows(double[][] rows)
                  throws NodeException
        Sets the manual NPT according to rows provided.
        Parameters:
        rows - 2D array where first dimension are the rows and second dimension are the cells
        Throws:
        NodeException - if provided table size is wrong or Node does not allow manual NPT

      • setTable

        public void setTable(org.apache.sling.commons.json.JSONObject jsonTable)
              throws NodeException
        Replaces the Node's probability table with one specified in the given JSON.
        Parameters:
        jsonTable - configuration of the table in JSON format
        Throws:
        NodeException - if table type does not match the rest of the table configuration, if table is not a square matrix or the number of cells does not match the number of partitions created by the combination of parent states

      • setTableFunction

        public void setTableFunction(java.lang.String function)
                      throws NodeException
        Sets Node function to the one provided.
        Resets Node table partitioning and sets Table type to Ref.TABLE_TYPE.Expression.
        Parameters:
        function - function to set
        Throws:
        NodeException - if function is invalid

      • setTableFunctions

        public void setTableFunctions(java.lang.String[] functions)
                       throws NodeException
        Sets Node functions to the ones provided.
        Also sets Table type to Ref.TABLE_TYPE.Partitioned.
        If the node only has one non-simulated parent, this parent will be automatically used to partition this node.
        Parameters:
        functions - functions to set
        Throws:
        NodeException - if a function is invalid

      • partitionByParents

        public void partitionByParents(Node[] partitionParents)
                        throws NodeException
        Sets node partitions based on the parent states.
        Order of partitions will be based on the order of nodes in the array and states within them.
        Parameters:
        partitionParents - parents to partition by
        Throws:
        NodeException - if one of the nodes in partitionParents is simulated or is not a parent of this Node

      • setStates

        public void setStates(java.lang.String[] states)
               throws NodeException
        Replaces Node's states by the ones given in the array.
        This action resets the probability table to uniform.
        Parameters:
        states - new Node's states
        Throws:
        NodeException - if state is an invalid range; or if the Node is simulated

      • setStates

        public void setStates(org.apache.sling.commons.json.JSONArray states)
               throws NodeException
        Replaces Node's states by the ones given in the JSON array.
        This action resets the probability table to uniform.
        Parameters:
        states - new Node's states
        Throws:
        NodeException - if state is an invalid range; or if the Node is simulated

      • setSimulated

        public boolean setSimulated(boolean simulated)
                     throws NodeException
        Changes the Node into a simulated node subject to conditions.
        Only ContinuousInterval and IntegerInterval nodes can be simulated.
        This action replaces States with dynamic states.
        Parameters:
        simulated - whether the node should be simulated or not
        Returns:
        true if the Node has been changed or false if it already was simulated
        Throws:
        NodeException - if Node type can not be simulated

      • isSimulated

        public boolean isSimulated()
        Returns true of the Node is simulated and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true of the Node is simulated and false otherwise

      • setId

        public void setId(java.lang.String id)
           throws NodeException

        Will lock IDContainer.class while doing so.
        Specified by:

      • unlink

        public boolean unlink(Node linkedNode)
        Removes a link between this Node and the linkedNode, if such link exists.
        Will check incoming and outgoing Links
        Both Nodes will no longer refer to each other
        Specified by:
        unlink in interface Networked<Node>
        Parameters:
        linkedNode - the Node to break Link with
        Returns:
        false if there was no Link; or true if the Link was removed
